title: Lancaster, Pennsylvania
summary: Lancaster (/ˈlæŋkəstər/ LANG-kə-stər; Pennsylvania German: Lengeschder) is a city in South Central Pennsylvania, that serves as the seat of Pennsylvania's Lancaster County and is one of the oldest inland towns in the United States.[4] With a population at the 2010 census of 59,322,[5] it ranks eighth in population among Pennsylvania's cities.[6]  The Lancaster metropolitan area population is 507,766,[7] making it the 104th-largest metropolitan area in the U.S. and second-largest in the South Central Pennsylvania area.[7]
